parameters.name: BX
parameters.description:
KSM X-component of the magnetic-field in nT. X points from Saturn to    
      the Sun.

parameters.name: BY
parameters.description:
KSM Y-component of the magnetic-field in nT. Y is perpendicular to the  
      magnetic dipole (Omega) and the Saturn-Sun direction (Omega x X).

parameters.name: BZ
parameters.description:
KSM Z-component of the magnetic-field in nT. Z is defined such that the 
      X-Z plane contains Saturn's centered magnetic dipole axis (M).

parameters.name: BTOTAL
parameters.description: Average of the magnetic field magnitudes in nT.

parameters.name: X
parameters.description:
KSM X component (Saturn-Sun) of the spacecraft range from the Saturn    
      center of mass in units of Saturn radii (1 Rs = 60268 km).

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description:
KSM Y component (Omega x X) of the spacecraft range from the Saturn     
      center of mass in units of Saturn radii (1 Rs = 60268 km).

parameters.name: Z
parameters.description:
KSM Z component (XZ planes contains Omega) of the spacecraft range from 
      the Saturn center of mass in units of Saturn radii (1 Rs = 60268 km).

parameters.name: LOCAL HOUR
parameters.description:
Angle between the observer's (Cassini) sub-Saturn meridian and the      
      anti-sunward meridian, measured in Saturn's equatorial plane in the     
      direction of planetary rotation. The local hour angle is converted to a 
      decimal hour (one hour equal to fifteen degrees longitude). The Sun     
      meridian is defined to be noon (12.000), with midnight (0.000) opposite 
      it. Dawn (6.000) and dusk (18.000) are where the sun rises and sets     
      according to the planet's rotation.

parameters.name: NPTS
parameters.description: Number of points in the average.
